Hello,

I am currently working with NEAT.  I am trying to alter the windows=
 version
to do some color recognition.  Primarily, my goal is to be able to=
 use the
algorithm.  After I feel comfortable with the code, I will apply i=
t to board
games.  I am hoping to create a neural network that will act as =
a heuristic
function.

Thanks,

-Chris Christenson (afro)

Hey all,

People have been steadily trickling in to the group
for the p=
ast few weeks, so I just wanted to officially
welcome those who've recently=
 joined.

I'm wondering who is now actively working with NEAT,
or a close v=
ariant, and then, if you're not currently,
who might be interested in worki=
ng with NEAT in the
future.

For those who haven't scoured the archives yet=
, I'm
Derek James, the moderator of the group.  Philip
Tucker (also on this=
 list) and I are working on a Java
implementation of NEAT that we hope to o=
pensource in
the near future.  We're primarily interested in board
game dom=
ains, specifically the Gomoku/Renju/Go class
of games, but also to a lesser=
 degree, other game
domains and real-time robot control.

Anyway, chime in =
if you like, and let us know what
you're up to, or what you're thinking abo=
ut.

Best,
Derek James
